kchandra423.kTesting

Class KUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • kchandra423.kTesting.KUtils

  • public class KUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides some basic utility methods to get classes within a project.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • callTests

        public static void callTests(java.lang.Class<?> testClass,
                             java.lang.String functionName)
                      throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                             java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                             java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Calls the given test within this class with the specified name. Testing methods must be static, void, and take no parameters. They also can not be named main.
        Parameters:
        testClass - The class to call the tests from
        functionName - The name of the function to be called
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - If the method does not exist
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - If the method cannot be called
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the method cannot be called

      • getClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getClass(java.lang.String className,
                                          java.lang.String srcFolder)
        Gets a given class within the target code with a given name
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class
        srcFolder - The absolute path of the project (The enclosing folder of the src code if on mac, and the src folder if on windows)
        Returns:
        The class with the given name
        Throws:
        KExistenceException - thrown if the class does not exist within the given folder

      • getClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getClass(java.lang.String className)
        Gets a given class within the target code with a given name
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class
        Returns:
        The class with the given name
        Throws:
        KExistenceException - thrown if the class does not exist within the given folder

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object o)
        Better to string method that either calls an objects to string method or the respective Arrays.toString method
        Parameters:
        o - The object being used
        Returns:
        The string representation of that object.
